verdict.summary: Container killed by OOM killer (exit code 137 = SIGKILL). Exceeded memory limit.

dead_ends.why_fails: System may freeze if container consumes all host memory
Container may consume all host memory and kill other processes

workarounds.action: Increase memory limit: docker run --memory=2g or in compose: mem_limit: 2g
workarounds.how: docker run --memory=2g or in compose: mem_limit: 2g

workarounds.action: Profile application memory to find leaks or reduce footprint
workarounds.how:
# Check memory usage of running container:
docker stats <container>

# Profile inside container:
apt-get install -y procps && top

# For Node.js, reduce heap:
NODE_OPTIONS=--max-old-space-size=512 node app.js

# For Python, use tracemalloc or memory_profiler

workarounds.action: For build-time OOM, increase Docker Desktop memory in Settings > Resources
workarounds.how:
# Docker Desktop > Settings > Resources
# Increase Memory to at least 4GB (default is 2GB)
# Increase Swap to 2GB
# Click 'Apply & Restart'

# For colima:
colima start --memory 4 --cpu 4

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'Container exited with code 137 (OOMKilled)' is a oom_error error while 'iptables failed' has a different failure mode despite similar symptoms. Check error message details to differentiate.
